data.text: Any of numerous arthropods of the subphylum Myriapoda, having segmented bodies, one pair of antennae, and at least nine pairs of legs, and including the centipedes and millipedes.
data.attributionText: from The American HeritageÂ® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Having very numerous legs; specifically, pertaining to the Myriapoda, or having their characters.
A member of the Myriapoda; a centiped or milleped. Also myriapodan.

data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.

data.text: Any <xref>arthropod</xref> (such as <xref>centipedes</xref> and <xref>millipedes</xref>) of the subphylum <xref>Myriapoda</xref>
data.attributionText: from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.

data.text: general term for any terrestrial arthropod having an elongated body composed of many similar segments: e.g. centipedes and millipedes
data.attributionText: from WordNet 3.0 Copyright 2006 by Princeton University. All rights reserved.
